sec.div: Effects of haemoparasite infection on BMI
sec.p: Intriguingly, the average BMI was significantly higher for birds infected with Haemoproteus spp. ( n = 97, mean 0.4), compared to noninfected birds ( n = 277, mean 0.4) ( F = 12.8, p = 0.0004). However, no differences were noted in BMI values between infected and non-infected birds for Plasmodium spp. ( p = 0.9532), Leucocytozoon spp. ( p = 0.5302), microfilaria ( p = 0.9203), or Trypanosoma spp. ( p = 0.1561).
